Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning against Devin Williams, leading the Mets to a 4-2 victory.
David Peterson got the final three outs to secure the win for the Mets.
Francisco Lindor walked and Brandon Nimmo singled before Alonso's homer.
Starling Marte added an insurance run with an RBI single in the ninth inning.
Jose Quintana pitched six shutout innings with four hits, one walk, and five strikeouts.
Jake Bauers hit a pinch-hit homer to break the scoreless tie.
Sal Frelick hit a home run on the next pitch after Bauers' homer.
Edwin Diaz got five outs without surrendering a run.
David Peterson struck out Joey Ortiz and induced a game-ending double play from Brice Turang.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed his desire to deliver for his team and contribute positively.
Mets president of baseball operations David Stearns expected something good to happen in the ninth inning.
Team owner Steve Cohen expressed excitement as Alonso's ball cleared the fence.
Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the team's resilience and ability to get back up after being knocked down.
Pete Alonso described the victory as really special.
Carlos Mendoza praised Jose Quintana's poise and calmness in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso displayed the 'Playoff Pumpkin' during the postgame celebration.
The Mets won their first postseason series since 2015.
The Mets advanced to the NLDS beginning on Saturday in Philadelphia.
David Peterson's relief appearance makes it likely that Tylor Megill will start Game 1 of the NLDS on Saturday.
